definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: Before giving my opinion, I thellonk it is essential to look at the argument of both sides.
sentences.chinese: 在揭曉我的定見之前，我以爲看兩邊的論據是根本的。

sentences.english: The jury was unable to reach a unanimous decision.
sentences.chinese: 陪審團未能告竣定見一致的裁決。

sentences.english: Do you really want to know my opinion?
sentences.chinese: 你真想知道我的定見嗎？

sentences.english: A double minded man is unstable in all his ways.
sentences.chinese: 心懷二意的人，在他一切所行的路上，都沒有定見。

sentences.english: On hearing his absurd opinion, I went snickering .
sentences.chinese: 聽了他荒謬的定見，我不由得笑着走開了。

sentences.english: Your opinions on packing will be passed on to our manufacturers.
sentences.chinese: 你們對包裝的定見將傳達給廠商。

sentences.english: Ability to listen and sensitivity to the needs of students.
sentences.chinese: 能傾聽學生定見，對學生的需求敏感。

sentences.english: I don't think we can say anything certain about that trend.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲不能對趨勢有定見。

definition: lit. to share the same bed with different dreams (idiom); ostensible partners with different agendas/strange bedfellows/marital dissension
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to write on the blackboard/writing on the blackboard
